preqs: ATS2044 or ATS3010 or ATS2066 or ATS2096 or ATS2146 or ATS2196 or ATS2226 or ATS3066 or ATS3096 or ATS3116 or ATS3146 or ATS3176 or ATS3196 or ATS3226 or proficiency equivalent to CEFR level B2+ or permission.

rules.ruleString: Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ATS2044, ATS2065, ATS2095, ATS2145, ATS2195, ATS2225, ATS3010, ATS3065, ATS3095, ATS3115, ATS3145, ATS3175, ATS3195, ATS3225}
(Must have passed a unit in {ATS2044, ATS2066, ATS2096, ATS2146, ATS2196, ATS2226, ATS3010, ATS3066, ATS3096, ATS3116, ATS3146, ATS3176, ATS3196, ATS3226} or  Permission required)
Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ATS2044, ATS2066, ATS2096, ATS2146, ATS2196, ATS2226, ATS3010, ATS3066, ATS3096, ATS3116, ATS3146, ATS3176, ATS3196, ATS3226}

description: This unit allows students to better understand the interaction between cultures by using translation as an analytical tool. It provides students with the opportunity to enhance their language skills and gain a basic theoretical knowledge in translating from English into other languages and from other languages into English. Students will work individually and collectively from a variety of text types and will engage with the main cultural issues involved in the translation process.
